reviews.review_msg: she's so cool ... reminds me of my buddy's mom
she is really nice and makes sense

Super helpful and supportive. Leads interesting discussions. Hard marker but provides great feadback to improve and this course was structured so that there were many assingments and opportunities to make up for bad marks. Great TA over all.

Barry is a funny guy, but extremely boring as a professor. He does not even seem interested in what he is teaching so how can anyone else be? Really did not enjoy this class, especially when Hilary Morden was my TA. Hugest nightmare of my life.

One of the more demanding core courses with 1 short paper and 2 - 8 page papers. Your mark depends on who your TA is, since they are marking your paper. The presentation/participation marks are easy marks.  His final is just like his other exams; and read the articles and pay attention to the movie he plays.
tries to make a boring subject entertaining with his powerpoints. good prof and a fair amount of assignments.

gotta put in a lot of work for this class. 2 8page papers marked pretty hard. final was pretty easy compared to all the course work. overall very dry material, barry tries to make it interesting. difficult class but will do fine if you put in the effort. make sure to get a good TA for the class though

Have had this course for crim 300 and 104. His text are easy just re-right notes he gives but papers are tough so got to the ta before you hand in to make corrections before you get a back mark. Enjoyed his classes

CRIM 300 is a writing intensive course, which scared me at first, but the way he had divided the total mark for class made it possible to compensate if you dont do well once. TA was hard on marking though, which made me a better writer!! GO to lecture though, if you dont you miss a lot
What can I say? This guy is the best prof at SFU and everyone should experience life w/ Barry at some point in time.  Great prof, easy exams, interesting lectures, great guy!
Awesome Prof! Theory can be pretty boring, but Barry manages to make lectures interesting and entertaining.

This was my 3rd class with Barry at SFU - he's one of the best professors I've ever had. Highly recommended! Very helpful, highly respectful towards his students. Asks us for future suggestions to improve his teaching tactics. Good sense of humor - fair marking, fair assignments. Finally, a professor who knows how to teach :)
bad marker

Took two classes with her, crim 300 and 321 and both were great! TA's were awesome and participation marks are great mark boosters. Papers for crim 300 were tough, 321 was good because she didnt require you to do the research. Final exam was easy! All written.

Good distance ed. class. Papers require efforts. Final exam is easy-to-do. TA seems to be helpful. The online participation and presentation are point grabbers so do well in them to bump up your marks.
Jacqueline is awesome! She is extremely helpful and encourages students to do well in the class by taking the time to post comments & feedback. Would definitely take another class w/ her again!
Had her for 230 last semester and she is AWESOME! very interesting...very engaging...VERY sad to see her go... =(

she makes theory INTERESTING! I KNOW! i didnt think that was possible either! but the way she applies it to real life, it kind of makes you think abt theory in a whole new light. and come to think of it, we use theory everyday in our lives, we just dont realize it. love her course, would and am taking her again.

She tries to make the material as interesting as possible. She loves what she's doing and is passionate about what she's teaching.  She's a good speaker, but can get a little dry sometimes. The workload is very manageable and she marks pretty easily.

Faubert tries her best to make the material interesting and easy to learn, which is all but impossible...Theory just sucks! She has everything going against her and yet she is personable, interested and helpful. Would take another class with her again.

Great prof. Very nice & approachable. The 2 papers are very easy, I didn't read the text, and did very well in the class. But make sure you listen in LEC, so you know what's going on. LEC is quite boring though. I would take Faubert again. 7/10.
She's a good prof, a little boring, but livable.
Theory class so she has that going against her. Lectures were a little boring but in a smaller format class like crime 452- very interesting and very approachable. Takes the time to get to know you.
Give her chocolate pudding before your exam
great prof. the class was a bore but her assignments were straightforward
she's very nice & helpful. she knows the crim theories well but her lectures are boring. this class is all about application of crim theories in papers.
Makes the theory class as good as it can get.  Unfortunately, it is still boring, but hey, it's a prereq!  A very pleasant, down-to-earth and easy to deal with person.  She will make time for you.

Well... it IS a theory course, but that aside it was tolerable and Jackie is a great lecturer, very receptive to questions and comments during lecture, and knows it forwards, backwards and inside out.
She is very thorough in her lectures..but lectures exact same as notes received from WebCT. Material is difficult, and assignments are kind of hard too. Work hard and u should be fine.
Jackie is one of the best prof's I have ever had. She is very fair and objective.  She makes theory fun and interesting.  Definately take this class with her, you will not be dissapointed.
She does an awesome job of trying to make theory interesting. Very good prof, highly recommend that you take this course with her cause theory can be SO boring.
She is an AWESOME teacher and she is very clear, fair minded, and tolerant of everybodys opinion

She loves criminology! She is extremely helpfull, and you get the impression that she can't wait to mark your paper. Best teacher ever to go see in office hours! She is the type of teacher that most departments could only dream of.

I like the fact that she is not bias and she explains all theories without promoting ones she likes and dissing ones she doesn't like.  She sticks to the facts and keeps her personal opinions out of class
She is an AMAZING teacher!  You actually leave her classes feeling as if you have learnt something!
Great prof, organized, knowledgeble and fair. Exams were fair and within my expectations

Jacky is a great prof. Her tests are very fair. She tests you on what you know rather than what you don't know. Partial lecture notes can be printed from WebCT. The material was interesting. Some of the articles were difficult to understand though.
